keyword: how many calories are in a dill pickle
title: How Many Calories Are in a Dill Pickle?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a dill pickle, including carbs, sodium, and other nutrients on a per-pickle basis, plus variations and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Dill Pickle?
assumptions: Medium-sized (65 g) whole dill pickle from a jar, fermented in brine, no added sugars or breading.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, brine ingredients, and whether homemade or store-bought. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium dill pickle has just 5 kcal and is low in fat and protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a dill pickle?
faqs.a: About 5 kcal for one medium dill pickle.

faqs.q: Are dill pickles high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one medium pickle has around 920 mg sodium from the brine.

faqs.q: Do dill pickles have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: Low carbs (1.1 g) and some fiber (0.5 g) per pickle.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a dill pickle?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 0.3 g per medium pickle.

faqs.q: How does pickle size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger pickles may have 10-15 kcal; smaller ones under 5 kcal. Adjust by weight.
